sub_topic: The Mandelbrot set and its fractal properties
message_1: What is the area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set? Express the answer as a decimal rounded to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
The area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set can be found using the formula:

Area = (π/4) * (2 - √2)

Calculating the area:

Area ≈ (3.14159/4) * (2 - 1.41421)
Area ≈ 0.785398 * 0.58579
Area ≈ 0.459697

Rounded to the nearest hundredth, the area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set is approximately 0.46.
